page.title: 06Childhood Memories
page.content: as remembered by Mrs Symons Mrs. Symons lived at Nicholashayne and so she had to walk the two miles to school every day carrying her lunch with her.She began school in l9O3. There were 14 children from that way so they would all walk together.They took skipping ropes and wooden hoops with them to play with on the way. Mr. Davey was the headmaster and there were seven standards to pass before you could leave school.The teachers were very strict but fair.Inspectors would come and check the childrens' books and Mrs.Symons remembers one telling her that although she wrote nicely she made the letter 'h' wrongly.The children would sit on benches and would be called up to the teachers desk if anything was wrong.For a penny a week they were
